articles.title: Apple market cap, momentum, MicroStrategy: Market Takeaways
articles.content: After US market indexes (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) closed in negative territory for the second session in a row, Apple's (AAPL) market cap crossed past a record $3.7 trillion. Yahoo Finance markets and data editor Jared Blikre joins Josh Lipton on Asking for a Trend to explain the trading day's biggest themes, including Apple's new market cap, momentum reversal patterns, and MicroStrategy's (MSTR) stock activity in relation to bitcoin (BTC-USD). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

articles.title: Tracking Ole Andreas Halvorsen's Viking Global Portfolio - Q3 2024 Update
articles.content: Viking Global's 13F portfolio value increases to $27.44B with top holdings in U.S. Bancorp, Adobe, Apple, Philip Morris, and Visa. Check out the holdings in Q3.

articles.title: Apple’s UK engineering teams have ‘doubled in size in five years’
articles.content: The iPhone maker said its investment in the UK in that time had risen to more than £18 billion.

articles.title: Apple to bring satellite communications to smartwatch next year, Bloomberg News reports
articles.content: The satellite feature is expected to come to next year's version of the iPhone maker's Apple Watch Ultra, the report said, citing people familiar with the matter.  Apple began to offer satellite communication through its iPhones in 2022.  In November, it invested $1.5 billion into satellite provider Globalstar to fund the expansion of iPhone communication services.

articles.title: Apple’s Next Ultra Smartwatch Will Be Able to Send Texts Via Satellite
articles.content: (Bloomberg) -- Apple Inc. plans to bring satellite connections to its smartwatch in 2025 and is ramping up work on a blood-pressure feature, seeking to entice hikers and health-conscience consumers into upgrading their devices.
